_header: Ever is six the best chance of the dice
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler TM 387; in some MSS followed by 5213; for texts which add a 4-line introduction see 6412.
_description: A political prophecy according to the throw of the dice — in couplets

BodRawD1062.First Lines:
[ ]st chaunce of þe dyce[ ]reth vp þe six [picture of a
                    dice with six dots]…
BodRawD1062.Last Lines:
…& when þe old is gon then haue at A new
                    Parlament
BodRawD1062.Note: Fourteen lines only; the corner of the folio is torn off.

CamTCC1157.First Lines:
When {six} is the best cast of the dyseand {one} berith vp {six}
                    then ynglond ys paradise…
CamTCC1157.Last Lines:
…The lyon the rede rose and the flouredelyceThe loke schall
                        nede vn do yet {six} schal bere the priceAnd {one} schall
                    help there to

BLAdd24663.Note:
Weiskott (2020)
XWeiskott,  Eric. 
             Meter and Modernity in English Verse, 1350–1650.
            
         Philadelphia: University of Pennsylvania Press, 2020.: 213.

BLCottCleoCIV.First Lines:
Euer is vi the best on the diceWhen ane bereth vp
                    vi…
BLCottCleoCIV.Last Lines:
…Yet vi shall haue þe priceAnd I shall helpe þer
                    to

BLHar559.Note:
10 lines; followed by 5213.  See Weiskott (2020)
XWeiskott,  Eric. 
             Meter and Modernity in English Verse, 1350–1650.
            
         Philadelphia: University of Pennsylvania Press, 2020.: 213.

BLHar7332.First Lines:
When Ale beareth vp syseIngland shall be in
                    paradise…
BLHar7332.Last Lines:
…When Deux putteth forth traye then all is spentThen must we
                    cum to a new parlyament
BLHar7332.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James. 
             Ballads from Manuscripts.
         London: Ballad Society, 1863; repr. New York: AMS, 1968: 1.319.

BLLan762.Note:
For the second entry, see Weiskott (2020)
XWeiskott,  Eric. 
             Meter and Modernity in English Verse, 1350–1650.
            
         Philadelphia: University of Pennsylvania Press, 2020.: 213. The first entry comprises 10 lines; followed by 5213.

BLSl2578.First Lines: for when [one] bearethe [five] & [six]then is englande paradise…
BLSl2578.Last Lines: …when Rome is removid into england& ilke pryste hathe þe popes power in handeBetwixt [six] & [three] who so will vnderstandemykell woo & wunder shalbe in englande

PROSP1232.First Lines: Whan sise ys the best Caste of the dyesce

TCD516.First Lines:
Euermore schalle the {six} be the best cast on the dyceWhan that
                    {one} beryth vp the {six} ynglond schal be as paradice…
TCD516.Last Lines:
…The Rede Rose and the floure delyce the lockes schal vnderYet
                    schal the {six} ber the pryce and {one} schal helpe therto
TCD516.Note:
10 lines; with glosses ‘i.e. vulgus’ over sixes and
                        ‘i.e. rex’ over ones.
